questions.question_text: Which two can an administrator whose organization is running VMware Horizon Standard use to determine the transport protocol being used by a user? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
The correct answer is A and D. The Horizon Help Desk Tool feature is not included in the Horizon Standard edition.
https://www.vmware.com/content/dam/digitalmarketing/vmware/en/pdf/products/horizon/vmware-horizon-perpetual-feature-comparison.pdf

Selected Answer: CD
these are true.

comments.content:
PS: I just tested it, feel free to compare it yourself:

Answer C - Agent Logfiles: 

 - Location: C:\ProgramData\VMware\VDM\logs
 - contains information: 2023-11-11T20:17:34.653+01:00 INFO (0AB8-1F34) <MessageFrameWorkDispatch> [wsnm_desktop] StartSession DESKTOP request for user domain\username with BLAST (cn=sid,cn=foreignsecurityprincipals,dc=vdi,dc=vmware,dc=int) {SESSION:76e4_***_b53b}

=> It shows the protocol used: Blast!

So (C) is a perfectly reasonable answer to me?!
And compared to A - which is an optional feature of the agent, C seems more reasonable to me.
I'm not starting an argument what is more likely in a reallife environment where you most likely will have the performance tracker installed... But the questions are theoretically, so you cannot assme this optional feature is available in this question's scenario..

Correct me if im wrong ;)

(D) is too, without question.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Why is noone voting C + D?
C: Wont the agent logs on a virtual machine show the connection/session information with protocol used???
D:: Ofcourse the Console shows sessions + protocol.

What speaks against the Performance Tracker: It is only an optional component of the Agent - it doesnt say anywhere, that all agents have been installed with full feautes, so you are just ASSUMING it might be available. Which can or cannot be true, so I'd rather say: C+D!

Selected Answer: AC
i think the Answer is A & C
Help desk tool isn't available in Horizon standard and the console only shows the display protocol NOT the transport protocol (UDP/TCP)

Selected Answer: AD
The Horizon Help Desk Tool feature is not included in the Horizon Standard editio

questions.question_text:
An administrator has been tasked with disabling USB redirection for all finance users in the virtual desktop environment.
Which of the following options would meet the requirement?

choices.D: Create a Horizon Smart Policy, disable USB redirection, and set a condition matching all finance users.
choices.B: Create a new golden image, deselect USB redirection at the Horizon agent installation, and push the new image to all desktop pools.
choices.A: Open the Horizon Console and in Desktop settings set the USB Access Policy to disabled for all finance users.
choices.C: Open the Horizon Console and in Global Policies set the USB Access Policy to disabled.

discussion.content:
D. Horizon Smart Policies let you control (e.g. disable) Horizon functionality for external users or other conditions.
https://www.carlstalhood.com/category/vmware-horizon/page/4/

Selected Answer: D
I'd go with D.
Option A) You can't select USB Access Policy in desktop settings (Source: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/virtual-desktops/GUID-5302A3F3-3EDA-426C-9998-CFDF26A4BD34.html).
Option B) Would affect all golden image users, not just finance users.
Option C) Again this would affect all pools as it's a global policy.
Option D) Correct (Source: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-remote-desktop-features/GUID-473D8FD8-DB10-408F-A2C1-029E4CFC5D9E.html)

Selected Answer: D
I would select D since Smart Profiles can match the exact affected users (Finance). As option B states "for all pools" this may not apply to the specific affected users and would be a global change.

comments.content: B Would surely affect all users of the golden image though, not just finance users.

discussion.content: I think B is correct answer

D
In Dynamic Environment Manager (formerly called User Environment Manager), the Horizon Smart Policies feature provides a single location for managing the user experience on Horizon 7, Horizon Cloud, and Horizon Apps. With the 9.10 release, the addition of computer-based policies means you can you configure general Computer Environment settings, as well as remote experience settings such as Flash multi-media redirection, integrated printing, USB redirection, and more.

questions.question_text:
After a disaster recovery failure which left the data center unavailable, a company's Horizon Administration Team has decided to increase the capacity of their
Horizon desktop pools and their resiliency.
Which two deployment options would support the requirement? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Horizon deployed on VMware Cloud on AWS.
choices.A: Horizon deployed on VMware Cloud on VMware.
choices.B: Horizon deployed in the same Local Data Center.
choices.C: Horizon deployed in a Remote Data Center.
choices.E: Horizon Desktop deployed as a Service on vCloud Air.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
There is no VMware Cloud on VMware and the same datacenter doesn't solve the datacenter outage problem.

Selected Answer: AD
B no>data center already crashed c> you we dont know remote data center resilient or can-do horizon cloud e: not as a service
C and D are the right answers

comments.content: Vcloud air was sold off in 2017 to a french company, please substantiate your claim
ugh nevermind i read this all wrong lol

discussion.content:
B
DirectFlex imports the settings of an application when the application is started.

questions.question_text:
A Horizon administrator wants to implement Dynamic Environment Manager so that application configuration data is injected when the application is started.
Which option would provide this feature?
